finalproject.utilities

Class Shooter

  • java.lang.Object
    • finalproject.utilities.Shooter

  • public class Shooter
extends java.lang.Object
    Shooter class uses odometry to turn robot to selected target. Then shoots a ball at the target. Currently uses a fixed angle but later on if 1.RObot position is known and 2. Target position is known, the angle to turn to could be calculated. Tuesday February 14, 2017 9:45am
    Author:
    thomaschristinck, alexmasciotra

      Constructors

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void floatMotor()
      Floats both launch motors.
      void lowerArm()
      Slowly lowers the launch arm to a horizontal position.
      void raiseArm()
      Slowly raises the launch arm to the vertical position to reduce robot size.
      void raiseArmToMove()
      Slowly raises the launch to an angle above the horizon to the robot to move with the ball.
      void rotate(int angle)
      Rotate the motor by a specified angle.
      void shoot()
      This can be called when the robot is in a position to shoot.
      void smoothAcceleration()
      Set acceleration and speed to a lower value.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Shooter

        public Shooter(lejos.hardware.motor.EV3LargeRegulatedMotor shooterMotorR,
       lejos.hardware.motor.EV3LargeRegulatedMotor shooterMotorL)
        This is the initializer. It gets the wheel motors from the odometer. The shooter motors should be passed when the initializer is called.

    • Method Detail

      • shoot

        This can be called when the robot is in a position to shoot.
